Author: wonderfulworldofmcd
Content:
I'm here push my Ketum agenda and first of all we must acknowledge the reality of our needs. If Parliament is to handle more draft laws and bills, we are obligated to conduct more hearings, invite more experts, and commission more studies, so that the laws we produce are informed and effective.

 As my Ketum has rightly stated: *None of this, even if we were to agree with only half of what has been proposed, can be afforded with just 150 billion*.

Our transport and protocol services must also meet the standards expected of a national parliament that represents the Republic, both domestically and internationally.

Beyond that, all of this requires proper funding. That is why the increase from 150B to 800B is not excess, it is necessity.

Author: aoin7891
Content:
The Acting Speaker is, by definition, a caretaker ‚Äî a guardian of continuity, not a claimant of authority. Until this Parliament elects its rightful Speaker, no individual may assume that position in substance or in representation.

So let us be clear before the people we serve: the authority of this chamber rests not in temporary seats or claims, but in due process. And that process demands an election ‚Äî not self-proclamation.
